intro: Cakile maritima proles aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Middle East. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to saline environments, making it a common species in coastal dunes. It produces small, edible seeds that are sometimes used in local cuisines. Its ability to tolerate harsh coastal conditions makes it an important pioneer species in ecological succession.
